org.mundo.net.transport.ip
Class IPTransportService

java.lang.Object
  org.mundo.rt.Service
      org.mundo.net.transport.ip.IPTransportService
All Implemented Interfaces:
ITransportService, IEmits, IMessageHandler
public final class IPTransportService
extends Service
implements ITransportService, IMessageHandler, IEmits

Implements a transport service based on IP. It uses TCP connections to transport messages, and UDP datagrams to discover nodes in the same subnet. The automatic discovery mechanism is quite powerful, but it is not trivial and requires proper configuration.

Local Discovery: In the default configuration, MundoCore only connects to processes on the local machine. Local discovery works as follows: MundoCore guarantees that if at least one node is run on a host, then any of these nodes is listening on the primary port. Nodes started in addition can then connect to this primary port and get information about all other neighbours from the process there. If the process holding the primary port goes down, another process immediately tries to allocate it.

Discovery in the local subnet: To discover other nodes in the same subnet, UDP broadcast-based discovery can be used. This option has to be explicitly enabled in the configuration file.

This service supports the profiles J2SE and CDC, but not CLDC.

Author:
Erwin Aitenbichler
See Also:
Mundo

shutdown

public void shutdown()
Description copied from class: Service
Shuts down the service. All subscriptions and advertisements are removed. If shutdown is overridden, this method must be called by means of super.shutdown (at the end) of the overriding method. In addition, a service's shutdown implementation must free all allocated system resources and terminate all custom threads.

Overrides:
shutdown in class Service

public boolean openAsync(TransportLink l)
Connects to the specified peer. The method asynchronously starts a connect operation to the specified peer. Always returns true.

Specified by:
openAsync in interface ITransportService
Parameters:
l - the transport link to open.
Returns:
true: Indicates that the operation was successfully started; or if a connection to the specified address and port is already open; or a connect operation is pending.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the service is currently shutting down.

openAsync

public boolean openAsync(TypedMap map)
Connects to the specified peer. The method asynchronously starts a connect operation to the specified peer. The map parameter is usually provided in neighbour messages.

Specified by:
openAsync in interface ITransportService
Parameters:
map - a map containing string ipaddr and int port.
Returns:
true: Indicates that the operation was successfully started; or if a connection to the specified address and port is already open; or a connect operation is pending.
false: if a parameter is missing in the map; or if the specified host is unknown.

open

public boolean open(java.net.InetSocketAddress addr)
Connects to the specified peer.

Parameters:
addr - the external IP address and port of the remote peer.
Returns:
true: Indicates that the socket could be connected successfully. However, this does not necessarily mean that the connection could be set up successfully, because this also requires a successful handshake; or if a connection to the specified address and port is already open; or a connect operation is pending.
false: If the socket could not be opened.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the service is currently shutting down.

down

public boolean down(Message msg)
Description copied from interface: IMessageHandler
Called when a message is sent to a remote peer. The handler has to process the specified message and then pass it on to the next lower handler in the stack. If the operation is successful, the handler returns true. In case of an error, the handler returns false. Note that if false is returned, then a handler higher up in the stack might try to retransmit the message. As a consequence, the same message will be passed to this handler again.

Specified by:
down in interface IMessageHandler
Parameters:
msg - the message to send.
Returns:
true if the message could be processed and passed down successfully; false otherwise.

up

public boolean up(Message msg)
Description copied from interface: IMessageHandler
Called when a message is received from a remote peer. The handler has to process the specified message and then pass it on to the next higher handler in the stack.

Specified by:
up in interface IMessageHandler
Parameters:
msg - the message received.
Returns:
true if the message could be processed and passed up successfully; false otherwise.
